The claim focuses on Gwen Graham: s voting record in Congress, specifically stating that she "voted against President Obama 52 percent of the time."
The expert: s verdict highlights that the claim slightly overstates Graham's votes against Obama by only considering part of her time in Congress, rather than her entire term.
Graham: s breaks with the White House were primarily on issues of national security, foreign policy, and energy, where she sometimes voted against the Obama administration's position.
According to an analysis by Congressiona: Graham supported the president on 49 percent of the House votes where the White House had a stated preference in 2015, indicating that she voted against Obama 51 percent of the time.
